docs.title: Wolf OS
docs.text:
Wolf OS Status

Wolf OS is in DEV ALPHA

Wolf OS is a in development ComputerCraft OS

docs.title: Registry
docs.text:
Registry DB

the Wolf OS Registry uses PropaneDB

the Wolf OS Registry is located at /wolfos/registry, it can also be accesed at 

_G.registry
registry

docs.title: Interface
docs.text: placeholder

docs.title: Catagorys
docs.text:
Crates

Crates are packaged programs for Wolf OS

Catagory Use system programs included with Wolf OS custom custom programs craftOS stock craftOS programs Crates programs installed thru crates

docs.title: Setings
docs.text:
Settings DB

the Wolf OS settings storage uses PropaneDB

warning

settings is not yet implemented

docs.title: Programs
docs.text:
Programs DB

the Wolf OS programs list uses PropaneDB

The Wolf OS Programs List is located at /wolfos/programList.

The program list by default refrences some stock craftOS programs and all Wolf OS system programs

docs.title: Adding Programs
docs.text:
Crates

Crates are packaged programs for Wolf OS and can be used as an alternate method of adding a program.

open lua shell (run shell then enter lua) and run 

progd = require("/wolfos.libs.progd")
dbw = progd.load()
:addProgram(<program name>,<path>,<program char icon>,[args])
:close()

docs.title: Required Data
docs.text: Data Description Program name the program's name Path the path to the program program char icon A single char for the program's icon Args (optional) any args to pass to the program

docs.title: Developing
docs.text: Use Library UIs Basalt (pre-installed) (used by os) Shells Stock Craft OS 3D Not suported Logging Log4l  (pre-installed) (used by os) Data Storage PropaneDB

docs.title: Permitions
docs.text: flag name flag value description perm.levels.ucv 1 user can view perm.levels.ace 2 admin can edit perm.levels.AdmSYS 4 admin can edit using sysApp perm.levels.System 8 system

docs.title: upgrading
docs.text:
local oldLevel = perm.getCurentLevel()
perm.upgrade(perm.makeCreds(<username>,<pasword>)) --upgrades if credentials are correct
print(perm.getCurentLevel()~=oldLevel) --prints out if upgrade worked

docs.title: Colors
docs.text:
please use the provided color pallete for your programs

Color Base Color Wolf OS white #F0F0F0 #FFFFFF orange #F2B233 #D06018 magenta #E57FD8 #C061CB lightBlue #99B2F2 #33c7de yellow #DEDE6C #f3f03e lime #7FCC19 #33d17a pink #F2B2CC #f66151 gray #4C4C4C #5e5c64 lightGray #999999 #d0cfcc cyan #4C99B2 #2aa1b3 purple #B266E5 #a347ba blue #3366CC #2a7bde brown #7F664C #a2734c green #57A64E #26a269 red #CC4C4C #c01c28 black #111111 #111111

docs.title: Crate
docs.text:
Missing from all versions ·

Crate

the crate packager has not yet been coded and is NOT comming soon, it is curently planed to be implemented for the V 1.0.0 update of Wolf OS

docs.title: Manefest
load
docs.text:
.load(<catagory>)
returns a ProgDB wrapper

docs.title: ProgDB
docs.text: Propane DB wraper

docs.title: addProgram
docs.text:
:addProgram(<program name>,<path>,<program char icon>,[args])
Arg Description Program name the program's name Path the path to the program program char icon A single char for the program's icon Args (optional) any args to pass to the program

docs.title: close
docs.text:
:close()
closes and saves any db changes

docs.title: Importing
docs.text:
unlike most lua librarys for propaneDB you need to run the result of require("/wolfos.libs.propaneDB") with a argument

local propane = require("/wolfos.libs.propaneDB")("db")
arg result ver version db the main propaneDB library

docs.title: load
docs.text:
.load(<path to db>)
opens the specifed db

docs.title: new
docs.text:
Creating DBs

the created database is not automaticly saved, see

.new(<path to db>)
creates the specifed db

docs.title: newTable
docs.text:
· 

:newTable(<table name>)

docs.title: setValue
docs.text:
· 

:setValue(<table>,<name>,<value>)
sets the specifyed value in the database

docs.title: getValue
docs.text:
:getValue(<table>,<name>)
gets the specifyed value from the database

docs.title: save
docs.text:
· 

:save()
saves database edits to file

    • Database edit, requires save
    • No edits to database
    • Saves database edits to file
    • chainable

    ↩
